title: Maple-Roasted Chicken Thighs Recipe
description: Maple syrup brings life to roasted chicken thighs, sweet potato wedges, and caramelized Brussels sprouts in this quick, easy, one-pan meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Fruits and Vegetables Vegetables Brussels Sprouts Roasted Maple-Roasted Chicken Thighs 4.9 (36) 35 Reviews 5 Photos A little maple syrup brings life to roasted chicken thighs, sweet potato wedges, and caramelized Brussels sprouts. Dried cranberries and pecans add tartness and crunch. Submitted by Jamie Updated on October 6, 2022 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 2 tablespoons maple syrup 1 tablespoon snipped fresh thyme 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided ¬æ teaspoon salt, divided ¬æ teaspoon ground black pepper, divided 1 pound sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch wedges 1 pound Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved 4 bone-in chicken thighs ¬º cup chopped toasted pecans ¬º cup chopped dried cranberries Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a 10x15-inch baking pan with foil. Whisk together maple syrup, thyme, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl. Set aside. Toss together sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts, 2 teaspoons olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Set aside. Brush chicken with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil; sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Arrange chicken, skin-side down, in the center of the prepared pan. Arrange sweet potato mixture around chicken. Roast in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Turn chicken over; brush chicken, sweet potatoes, and Brussels sprouts with maple syrup mixture. Continue to roast until sweet potatoes are tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of chicken near the bone should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Sprinkle with pecans and cranberries to serve. Add Your Photo Photos of Maple-Roasted Chicken Thighs 01 of 05 Photo by¬† Allrecipes Member 02 of 05 Photo by¬† R H 10/14/2024 Easy to follow Worth the effort üëçüëç and made per instructions. Perhaps next time I'll try some of the variations suggested. 03 of 05 Photo by¬† Ken Harris 10/25/2020 Great Recipe. My wife doesn't like Brussel sprouts so I made it with half sprouts and half broccoli florets for her. I will definitely do this again. 04 of 05 Photo by¬† Jenny Arihood-Hanabarger 09/05/2020 I made a little more maple syrup glaze than the recipe called for because I was sure I have a little more veggies and one extra chicken thigh. Other than that, I made it just as the recipe said and it turned out great! 1 You‚Äôll Also Love Chicken, Apple, and Brussels Sprout Sheet Pan Dinner 31 Ratings Sheet Pan Roasted Chicken Thighs with Brussels Sprouts 20 Ratings Sheet Pan Chicken and Veggies with Mustard Vinaigrette 11 Ratings Make-Ahead Sausage and Veggie Bowls 1 Rating Lemon Garlic Shrimp with Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Brown Rice Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Kielbasa 89 Ratings Maple Bacon Brussels Sprouts 14 Ratings Spicy Brussels Sprout Chips 32 Ratings Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Parmesan 74 Ratings Roasted Brussels Sprouts 4,339 Ratings Maple Roasted Brussels Sprouts with Bacon 566 Ratings Crispy Parmesan-Crusted Roasted Brussels Sprouts 33 Ratings Duck Fat-Roasted Brussels Sprouts 18 Ratings Fall Quinoa Salad with Poppy Seed Dressing 2 Ratings Sriracha Honey Brussels Sprouts 79 Ratings Sheet Pan Vegan Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Butternut Squash 17 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: Jamie
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a 10x15-inch baking pan with foil.;Whisk together maple syrup, thyme, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a small bowl. Set aside.;Toss together sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts, 2 teaspoons olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl. Set aside.;Brush chicken with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil; sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Arrange chicken, skin-side down, in the center of the prepared pan. Arrange sweet potato mixture around chicken.;Roast in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Turn chicken over; brush chicken, sweet potatoes, and Brussels sprouts with maple syrup mixture.;Continue to roast until sweet potatoes are tender and chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of chicken near the bone should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).;Sprinkle with pecans and cranberries to serve.
